poem:
### Echoes of the Park

In Echo Park's embrace,  
they chased the shadows  
of enough-ness,  
in spa's steamy haze.  
Whispers of new freedom  
tangled with old fears—  
not enough, yet touching  
their almost-wholesome  
LA dream,  
where boundaries blur  
like smog at dusk,  
a hesitant, hesitant  
awakening.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Sex in an LA spa was strangely wholesome, like an extension of the wellness experience’: This is how we do it in America Rob, 34 I’ve resisted the idea of fooling around – I feared the subtext was that I wasn’t enough If we hadn’t moved to Los Angeles, Mikey and I would never have started experimenting with non-monogamy. We bought a house in Echo Park last year and started socialising with a group of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
